question.text: Which of the following is a '5C' compound formed during Kreb's cycle in the matrix of the mitochondria?

solution.text: During oxidation of Pyruvic acid in matrix of mitochondria different  <math><mn>6</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>5</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>4</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>  intermediates are formed.  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">α</mi></math> -ketoglutaric acid is a  <math><mn>5</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>  intermediate which is formed during Kreb's cycle in matrix of mitochondria.
